messages.subject: [AlwaysLearning] handwriting samples
messages.msgSnippet: ... I thought there was also discussion of backwards handwriting and Sandra sent some of hers.  Or am I remembering wrong? Nanci K.
messages.messageBody:
>It was about how we interpret people through writing,
>and that with e-mail some of the clues are missing,
>like handwriting.
>Sandra

I thought there was also discussion of backwards
handwriting and Sandra sent some of hers. Or am I
remembering wrong?

Nanci K.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] handwriting samples
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/2/02 1:32:00 PM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/2/02 1:32:00 PM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< There was a discussion on handwriting analysis at one point I believe. And
someone suggested posting them and Voila! There they were. >>

It was about how we interpret people through writing, and that with e-mail
some of the clues are missing, like handwriting.

Sandra

messages.subject: handwriting samples
messages.msgSnippet: I am wondering why there are a couple of handwriting samples there.  Anyone know? There was a discussion on handwriting analysis at one point I believe. And
messages.messageBody:
I am wondering why there are a couple of
handwriting samples there. Anyone know?

There was a discussion on handwriting analysis at one point I believe. And
someone suggested posting them and Voila! There they were.

Ren
